meanings.definition: A thick, solid piece of something
meanings.sent1: She bit into the chocolate bar and tasted the sweet chunks.
meanings.sent2: The soup was filled with delicious vegetable chunks.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the yarn, unraveling it into messy chunks.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was breaking into tiny emotional chunks.
meanings.sent5: The rocks in the cave formed rough, jagged chunks.

meanings.definition: A large amount or portion of something
meanings.sent1: He ate a huge chunk of the cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The company invested a significant chunk of money in research.
meanings.sent3: The kids were thrilled to receive a big chunk of candy on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was filled with a massive chunk of meetings.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds covered a vast chunk of the sky.

meanings.definition: To break or divide into large pieces or chunks
meanings.sent1: She carefully chunks the vegetables before adding them to the stew.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack chunks the logs with precision and strength.
meanings.sent3: He chunks the clay into different shapes for his pottery project.
meanings.sent4: The demolition crew will chunk the old building into manageable pieces.
meanings.sent5: The chef chunks the meat for the stir-fry, ensuring even cooking.
